page.title: 12Culcheth Linear Park
page.content: Culcheth Linear Park is an interesting place to find out about wildlife. There are many footpaths in the Linear Park, and plenty of benches to sit on. There is plenty of room to walk around and to let your dog have a good run. There is a bridle-way for horses and a pleasant stream along the side of the footpaths. The Rangers help to conserve the wildlife and nature around the Park. The Rangers hold a Junior Rangers Club on Saturdays and Sundays and go on litter patrols. It was built in 1983 by Warrington Borough Council. It started to provide a nature park for the people of Culcheth to enjoy in their leisure time.
